paper_abstract: In a previous paper, [17] Part Two, was investigated an initial boundary value problem for the operator Lu(x, t) = partial derivative(2)u/partial derivative t(2) - [tau 0/m + kappa/m gamma(t) - gamma 0/gamma 0 + kappa/2m gamma(t) integral(beta(t))(alpha(t)) (partial derivative u/partial derivative x)(2) dx] partial derivative(2)u/partial derivative x(2), which is a model for small vibrations of an elastic string with moving ends and variable tension. Without restrictions on the initial data we proved local solutions in t. The present paper is dedicated to study a unilateral problem for Lit with no restriction on the initial configuration u(0) and the initial velocity u(1) has a bounded gradient. We succeed to prove that the solution of the unilateral problem has a solution for all t epsilon [0,T], T a positive arbitrary number.
paper_title: Vibrations of elastic strings: Unilateral problem
